ticket_information.price_category: ANYTIME DAY SINGLE (1ST CLASS, ANY PERMITTED)

conditions.label: Flexible ticket with no time restrictions on when you can travel.
Your journey must be on the date specified.
Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund from the My Account pages, or through Customer Support within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. A GBP 10.00 administration fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

You can change the time of journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.
Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.
Only Senior, Disabled Persons and HM Forces Railcards secure discounts in First Class, and, subject to time restriction, the Two Together Railcard.
You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.
Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.
FDS
Travel is allowed via any permitted route.

passengers.price_category: ANYTIME DAY SINGLE (1ST CLASS, ANY PERMITTED)
passengers.title: MR

conditions.label: Flexible ticket with no time restrictions on when you can travel.
The outward portions of Anytime Returns are valid for five days including the date on the ticket. You must return within one calendar month of the outward travel date specified.
Can be booked in advance or purchased on the day of travel.

If you decide not to use your ticket to make all or part of your intended journey then you can apply for a refund from the My Account pages, or through Customer Support within 28 days of expiry of the ticket. Please note, the outward portion cannot be refunded if the return portion has been used. A GBP 10.00 administration fee will apply and the amount of the refund will take into account any use you have made of the ticket and in some circumstances no refund will be paid.

You can change the time of your outward journey and the date and time of your return journey without changing your tickets. If you wish to change your date of travel or Class of ticket, you will need to buy a new ticket and apply for a refund on your current ticket.
Yes - normal railcard and child discounts available.
Only Senior, Disabled Persons and HM Forces Railcards secure discounts in First Class, and, subject to time restriction, the Two Together Railcard.
You may start, break and resume, or end your journey at any intermediate station along the route of travel.
The outward portion of an Anytime Return ticket is only valid for travel when accompanied by an unused return portion.
Mobile Tickets and etickets aren't valid for travel on London Underground. See our FAQs for more info.
FOR
Travel is allowed via any permitted route.
